intro: Girgensohnia minima, commonly known as the dwarf girgensohnia, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, often pale or white flowers that are typically arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Girgensohnia minima thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
